headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Soon, House To Debate GOP Rep. Santos Expulsion Resolution; Musk To Advertisers Fleeing X: "Go F Yourself"; Vermont Shooting Victim Details Harrowing Ordeal To CNN; Fierce Fighting As Russian Troops Advance On Ukraine's Eastern Front; Blinken Speaks After Meeting With Israeli Leaders. Aired 2:30-3p ET

utterances.speaker: BORIS SANCHEZ, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: We should point out, he hasn't been convicted, but members of his staff have pled guilty to crimes and are implicating him.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: ALICE STEWART, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: And look, he can certainly make his case before Congress. He will certainly make his case in a court of law.He's had the opportunity repeatedly to address these claims individually. As he said this morning, I'm not going to unpack this at this time. Well, there's no time like the present. And if people have questions, then they deserve answers.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Elon Musk is finally apologizing for an anti-Semitic tweet he supported on his social media platform earlier this month. It comes after more than a dozen advertisers, including major media companies, cut ties with X. But when it came time to address those companies, he didn't apologize. Instead he -- just watch.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ELON MUSK, X OWNER
utterances.sentences: If somebody's going to try to blackmail me with advertising, blackmail me with money, go (EXPLETIVE DELETED) yourself. Go (EXPLETIVE DELETED) yourself.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: MUSK
utterances.sentences: Is that clear? I hope it is.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: CNN's senior media reporter, Oliver Darcy, joins us now.Oliver, what do you make of this defiant stance by the head of X?

utterances.speaker: OLIVER DARCY, CNN SENIOR MEDIA REPORTER
utterances.sentences: It's certainly, Boris, not going to bring back those advertisers that left his platform, those advertisers he desperately needs if he wants to keep X afloat.Because X is primarily -- they generate most of their revenue from advertisements. Without companies like Disney, Apple, IBM, advertising on the platform, they're not going to be bringing in much revenue. Let's listen to Elon Musk as he explained what's going to happen to the site because these advertisers are boycotting it. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MUSK
utterances.sentences: What this advertising boycott is going to do, it's going to kill the company.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MUSK
utterances.sentences: And the whole world will know that those advertisers killed the company. We'll document it in great detail.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: But those advertisers are going to say, we didn't kill the company.

utterances.speaker: MUSK
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They're going to say --

utterances.speaker: MUSK
utterances.sentences: Tell it to earth.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They're going to say, Elon, that you killed the company because you said these things and they were inappropriate things and they didn't feel comfortable on the platform. Right?

utterances.speaker: MUSK
utterances.sentences: Let's see -- let's see how earth responds to that.(END VIDEO CLIP) DARCY: What's remarkable here, Boris, is that Elon Musk is not taking any real responsibility for these advertisers leaving the company. Of course they're leaving because of his unhinged behavior on the platform. Over the last year, since he took over, he has smeared journalists, he's launched ugly attacks against the Anti-Defamation League and George Soros. He's promoted conspiracy theories like Pizza-Gate, even as of late. And of course, he's made that anti-Semitic endorsement. So there's a lot of behaviors advertisers are seeing from Musk, which they don't want to associate with. That's why they've fled his platform in droves. But he's blaming them of this self-inflicted wound. It's remarkable to see -- Boris?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oliver Darcy, thanks for telling it to earth. Appreciate it.Brianna?

utterances.speaker: KEILAR
utterances.sentences: Well, it was like being in a living nightmare. That's how one of the three Palestinian college students who was shot Saturday in Vermont is describing his terrifying ordeal.And 20-year-old Kinnan Abdalhamid and his mother, Tamara Tamimi, appearing today on "The View" to talk about the trauma they're both living with. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINNAN ABDALHAMID, VERMONT SHOOTING VICTIM
utterances.sentences: It was almost surreal how quickly he did it. I still kind of remember it.And even at the moment it was kind of moving in a nightmare. It's, like, not -- the way I perceived it wasn't the same. It really felt like I was in a living nightmare.

utterances.speaker: TAMARA TAMIMI, MOTHER OF VERMONT SHOOTING VICTIM
utterances.sentences: We're incredibly concerned for his friends who are still in critical condition.It's hard to make sense of this. It really is. Except just to say, when people are dehumanized and there's rhetoric by government officials and by the media where Palestinians are not really seen as human, right? We, you know -- with this conflict in Gaza, we have the U.S. administration doubting the number of people that have died. We have to sort of prove how many babies have been killed. And at this time, quite honestly, I feel like no Palestinian is safe anywhere. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: Incoming explosions --(EXPLOSION)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: -- outgoing fire.(GUNFIRE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: As one of Ukraine's assault infantry units of the 47th Mechanized Brigade tries to take back trenches in Avdiivka captured by Russian forces.OLEH SENTSOV, COMPANY COMMANDER, 47TH MECHANIZED BRIGADE (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: "We need drones, we need drones", says company commander, Oleh Sentsov, filming on his GoPro."The bastards are sitting in the tree line shooting at us," he explains. (EXPLOSION)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: In a rare interview, the former filmmaker, imprisoned by the Russians in 2014 for five years, tells me about last month's mission in what has become one of the hottest spots on the Eastern Front.SENTSOV (through translation): My goal was for people to watch this and know what this war is really like. Because it's very important to record this so that people know now and know later what a cruel and terrible war it is.

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: One of his troops has been hit.(GUNFIRE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: They remove his body armor to reveal a bullet hole.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: As they apply a chest seal, the team has even bigger problems than they had.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: "Duck, the tank is coming," yells one of them.(GUNFIRE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: And then the war from the sky begins.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: "Drone, drone, FPV," yells a soldier.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: "I see it," another shouts back.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: Minutes later, another soldier is hit. This time, shrapnel to the legs.

utterances.speaker: SENTSOV
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: While talking on the radio reporting on his injured troops, Oleh also gets hit --(GUNFIRE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: -- but doesn't realize for a few moments.(GUNFIRE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: "There's a small hole. I see the blood. You're bleeding," says the female paramedic.Quickly patched up, Oleh remains focused and composed, until, suddenly, they hear the rumble of tanks. Oleh's unit tries to bury themselves in the earth as one drives by. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: The female paramedic cries --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: -- "We are surrounded, the tanks are shooting on us."Approximately 40 tons of terror, so close the earth is shaking. (GUNFIRE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: Drone footage taken by the Ukrainian military shows four Russian tanks firing on the tree line.Positioned in those trees are three Ukrainian assault groups in trenches spread out over a kilometer. Oleh's unit is in the middle. They were the only ones to be spared. SENTSOV (through translation): We failed to hold our position and had to retreat. We had injuries but survived. But the other two groups were almost completely destroyed.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: COREN
utterances.sentences: This is the first time Oleh has failed a mission as commander in the almost two years that he's been here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)

utterances.speaker: KEILAR
utterances.sentences: All right, let's listen now to Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
